Let's dig into fee abstraction in the interchainüëá 
You typically need to hold a chain's native token to pay transaction fees.

For instance, if you don't have enough ETH to cover the costs, you can't complete a swap on a typical Ethereum-based DEX.

This barrier adds a layer of friction & complexity.
So, what's the solution? ü§î

Letting you pay fees using any token, so you don't have to jump through hoops to acquire gas tokens on every chain you interact with.
Transaction fees on Osmosis have been payable in assets other than the native token since the v5 software upgrade in 2021.

But what about other IBC chains that want to improve UX and let their users benefit from this flexibility?
@OsmosisGrants provided funding to support the development of the Fee Abstraction (FA) Module.

Any chain that implements the FA module can allow its users to pay gas fees in any IBC token, leveraging Osmosis on the back end to facilitate swaps back to their native token. https://twitter.com/1432019140022177795/status/1828919116377510281
Osmosis contributors are constantly working to provide the best UX in DeFi, and when possible, allow other networks (and their users) to benefit from these innovations.

For more on the Osmosis Fee Abstraction module, check out the docs below üëá

https://docs.osmosis.zone/overview/features/fee-abstraction/
